title: Ritte Satyr 2.0 titanium gravel frame is handmade in Portland, but limited to just 20 frames
content:
In late 2019, Ritte announced two new steel steeds – the Phantom and the Satyr. Both bikes were meticulously designed by Tom Kellogg, and then made overseas to Ritte’s exact spec. However, if you’re holding out for a Tom Kellogg designed frame that’s made in the USA, this is your chance – though inventory is […]

The post Ritte Satyr 2.0 titanium gravel frame is handmade in Portland, but limited to just 20 frames appeared first on Bikerumor.
author: Zach Overholt
